result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:14 AM Defendant Timothy J Waite in court.  Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. appeared by Zoom for Timothy J Waite.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Request from Attorney to appear via zoom.
**Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 10-27-2022. "If waiver form uploaded by 4 p.m. today, the defense may appear by Zoom. If not, parties are to be in person. Both counsel and defendant must have fully functioning Zoom both audio and video if this is to happen."
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.

dated 09-22-2022, filed by Atty. Sarvan Singh Jr requesting an adjournment of the hearing on 09-29-2022

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 09-22-2022: The matter may be rescheduled. Schedule on the commissioner calendar for a Preliminary hearing.**
Atty. Sarvan Singh Jr.

Hearing on September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:31 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Timothy J Waite in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:12 PM Defendant Timothy J Waite in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant states he has contacted Attorney Sarvan Singh Jr. and has not received a call back.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy J Waite
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2022)
Prior: 9916 W Wildwood Ct, Milwaukee, WI 53227
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle during the pendency of this case.
The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration to stay on until further order of the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

03:09 PM Defendant Timothy J Waite in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.  
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
